I can only assume the sight of an empty starting town won't keep them playing for very long.

Fiesta kind of reminds me of the world in Dark Souls.  It's past its prime, and its waiting for the end to come. But in Fiesta's case, it's seems like the sooner that happens. the better

reviewText:
OVERVIEW

Fiesta Online is an anime adventure MMORPG. It is published by gaming AG who is almost an unknown company since most of the games they published is extremely forgettable or just didn't received well by both players & critics. Despite my short playtime,i really have to say that i can't enjoy the game that much mainly due to many horrid decisions and turn-off combat system.

GAMEPLAY : 5/10

The most important things when it comes to MMORPG is the character creation. However is so poorly done with little to no customization to your character so basically a lot of people gonna look the same. There is a total of 6 class available for you to choose,one of them being unlockable if you able to reach your character to level 60 ( that class is a crusader class ).  Cleric is one of the best class in my opinion mainly because the huge amount of buff and healing ability.

The tutorial and guide tip present to you is fairly well done though some of them are not well explained enough. Quest can get extremely repetitive as you need to travel quite far to your quest destination and once you complete it,you need to go back to the quest giver for your rewards. I don't mind this but your character moves way too slow though you can buy mounts early with real cash.

Skill progression is very linear as there is no skill tree and you able to buy different type of them from the merchant. From there the skill points you earn from leveling up let you upgrade the skills you buy from the merchant. Leveling can get extremely grindy,took too long & not rewarding at all.

There is a emoticons system you could messed around so that a plus i guess.

Also i have to give them a credit for having an auto-navigations system so you don't get lost easily.

GRAPHICS : 4/10

The cartoonish artstyle they were going for fail to impress me.

Character models look so awkward and a lot of environment is extremely bland.

The details on the monster decent and a lot of variety you see later on the game.

The world can look pretty appealing but at the same times it make you want to vomit so it a mixed bag.

To be honest the game graphics look pretty uninspired and it sure it doesn't look like it came out in 2007.

AUDIO : 5/10

The soundtrack is pretty nice for the most part since some of them have upbeat soundtrack. Though it might be really repetitive because not much variety put into it and it also kinda short.

I believe this game doesn't have any voice acting at all for a lot of the NPC including yourself. You will only hear scream,yell & grunt.

Sound effects wise is not really that great but it acceptable nonetheless.

LONG-LASTING APPEAL : 6/10

If you managed to get far into the game,i think you start to appreciate the game a little bit.

The game offers a lot of events,quest,PvP system and many dungeons for you to explore.

While i may not venture further into the game,i could say the world is vast judging by the map.

You can mange your own guild and do questing with your own guild members together for an enjoyable experience.

FINAL VERDICT : 5/10

I wouldn't recommend this game even for a fan of point & click MMORPG.

Though the game offer some variety in some way,the combat system is just extremely lackluster and skills progression is very linear.

Not to mentioned the cash shop system have a lot of pay 2 win items and very few permanent items you can bought ( most of them have 30 days limit times ).

If you really wanted to give it shot at this game,be my guest but prepare to be dissapointed a lot.

At least invite some friends to join you in playing this game otherwise playing alone get super boring.

Oh and the player base is almost non-existant at least for some part of the server.

Is it one of the worst MMORPG to be released on steam ? Maybe. Is it one of the worst MMORPG ever made ? Not even close but it could be better.

GRADE : E ( Passable )

This is the game that got me into online gaming. What can I say? I saw an ad, liked the colorful characters, and signed up. It's a fairly unimaginative game with very little free customization. I began playing back in 2008 and when I tried signing in a few months ago, my characters had been deleted, including all my mounts, custom character designs, and upgraded weapons (all of which cost money). I didn't try very hard to get the game back up and working after that.

But back in 2008, I invested a ton of time and a nice chunk of money in Fiesta Online. What eventually drove me away was the community and the grinding. If either could have been better, I might have stuck around but the carpal tunnel-like symptoms and the bickering were enough to make me quit.

I tried signing in again today, knowing full well it would mean starting over. I was curious. The same three hairstyles, three faces, and three hair colors are present. They updated the character creation screen but it fails to impress. Fiesta Online is a free-to-play MMORPG. Fairly standard stuff. The cartoonish graphics are easy on the eyes and the Lore is fairly rich. Most importantly, however, the community is fairly nice and it's easy to make friends here. While there are items that require cash to buy, there's no real pressure in the game to get them. If I were to recommend any MMORPG to someone, it would definitely be this one.

However, Fiesta Online has one critical flaw: it is a time-draining, virtually-endless game. Do not play this game unless you are willing to sacrifice at least 4 hours a day, every day, for the rest of your life. The game is definitely easy to work with for the first ten levels, but the next ten are truly horrifying. Getting to level 20 in this game is incredibly difficult. It's not that the game is challenging; the hard part comes from forcing yourself to sit there and grind for the countless hours necessary to get out of the gloom that is the lv. 17-19 range. The game picks up after that, but only for so long. The cruel cycle continues to repeat itself. This game will eat your life.

If you like the typical WoW-style MMORPG setup, then, sure, this game is great. However, ultimately, I cannot in good conscience recommend this game to anyone.

reviewText:
So, I have to take the time out to give this game a review. Despite the number of hours logged through Steam, I have played this game for a very long time. It deserves some love. Let me tell you a little about Fiesta Online.

If you're looking for the next-big-thing, this isn't it. No, it's not like WoW or TERA. It's not Black Desert, either. It's an older game that's changed companies a few times, had it's share of population dips, and (shock) still has some bugs. It IS, however, still a very good game and will provide you with a lot of old-fashioned entertainment.

I'm not going to do a formal Pros/Cons, but I am going to casually tell you about the game should you be in the midst of a decision on whether or not you want to try it out.

This game is very generic in a lot of good ways. Yep, you read that right. It has all of the traditional things you would want in a MMO. Yes, you can buy and level up skills. Yeah, you can quest to your heart's content. It's got the trinity system you'd want from a standard game like this. The game still gets new content. It still gets patches that work on improving existing problems. The graphics have even been updated recently. It has six classes with each having a branch-choice at level 100 for a total of 12 end-game roles. The game has just the right amount of tradtion to relax ya. Grab a cold drink, sit  back, and enjoy some good old-fashioned game play.

Aesthetically speaking, the maps are bright, colorful, and easy on the eyes. There's not a huge deal of customization, but you do have the option of furthering your character's design through the cash shop. reviewText:
I have sunk a few years into this game. I originally had it before it came out on Steam, and the only reason I got it through steam was because I stopped playing and uninstalled it at one point. It was originally owned by a company called Outspark, and it hasn't changed all that much since it switched over to Gamigo. Mostly skin changes for monsters and the starter town.. oh and maybe some NPCs.

In terms of classes, it doesnt really matter what you pick since all the quests are the same. There is no story line whatsoever. There are seasonal events, and the premium item store holds some goodies if you are willing to spend real cash in order to get store currency. It has been said that FO has become a pay to win game, but as long as you're willing to put in the hours, it is possible to reach cap without premium items. I dont suggest battlefields, pvp dungeons or PVP kingdom quests without premium items... which I guess proves the pay to win section.

The enhancement system is also a lot harder if you dont use premium items, and even though enhancement offers some perks, and makes your gear prettier... it is still possible to play without, or you can always farm/sell for in game currency and hope to buy off another player. Players stores can be ridiculously priced though.. unfortunately people dont really offer an item for what it's really worth and tend to overprice useless gear. Be mindful of your class and stats before buying from other players, and really consider whether it is actually worth the price.

It has its pros and cons like any game, but if you're into things like this then by all means give it a go. It's not so bad, as long as you're willing to sink hours into it. (Though... if memory serves... since I havent started a new character in a very long time... you can get to level 30 within a couple hours)

reviewText:
I've played Fiesta for a few years now, and I just want to clarify some things up.

Fiesta has changed drastically over the years since I've joined the community, and I'm pretty well adjusted to it. It is not a pay to win game, it is only pay to win if you choose to pay to win. The only useful things you can buy that actually help combat wise and gameplay is enhancement bundles, so your item doesn't break when you want to upgrade it. Fashion gives you slight crit buffs or hp etc. and it's not that effective unless you have a lot, either way you don't need to pay to get these kinds of buffs. Just build your character right, and you have a pretty easy going time.

[Fighters] usually build END, and STR. Me personally, I build STR and DEX for damage and so I don't miss and have much more evasion when I fight.
[Archers] build DEX, SPR, and sometimes END depending on what kind of gameplay you would like, like if you wanted to AoE, you would need a bit more END.
[Clerics] build full END, or END, SPR, and STR (sometimes). Clerics are the tankiest class in the game, but you also build SPR for more mana so you don't just kill it with a set of buffs.
[Mages] build INT and SPR. INT for magic damage (I usually go full INT), and SPR for more mana and crits.
[Tricksters] build STR, SPR, and DEX. Tricksters have the fastest attack speed and the highest crit chance, evasion, and hit chance. I mained a trickster for a while before switching to Fighter.
[Crusaders] I have yet to experience. I'm sure they build STR and END. I've seen some crusaders that build tanky and others that build pure damage and destroy everything. Though you need a level 60+ character in order to make a Crusader.

But yeah in conclusion, I would give this game a try. It's pretty fun, just takes some time to get used to some stuff. There are even vaults you get every so levels that help your experience, whether it be from fashion to mounts, from resting houses to weapons. They reward you for leveling up. Plus if you're running out of money, you could join an academy and every level from 10-60, you'll get money and item rewards for leveling up. I'd give it a try.

reviewText:
I read another review here that said that this game is recommended to those who are just starting to play mmorpgs. I completely agree. Fiesta was one of the first mmorpgs I've ever played and somehow, I still love it (even with all the repetiveness and grinding). Why? The community is nice (which I find very assuring when you're just a starter, so this is the big concept I want to point out to beginners). People will always help you when you're least expecting it; whether it be a random buff from a cleric or people asking if you need help in your guild -you can always rely on the community.
I might be naive saying this, but I've played other mmorpgs to some extent as well, and at some point they all have their repetiveness, so as far as the gameplay goes... what's so bad? The skills have increasing levels that you unlock as you level up, and skills that you eventually come to gain. You don't come equipped with all your skills and for me, I found that such an exciting experience when I first started playing. [If anyone else has played Vindictus then I would like to compare: you do get skills along the way, and can level them up to some degree, but unless you're not into the whole paladin/dark knight thing then there's no other skills] I always looked forward to getting new skills in Fiesta and still do (because I haven't reached the level cap yet since I've taken such a long time off this game, but I still come back to it).
Now if you don't like grinding or P2W then sorry; this is definitely NOT the game for you if you plan on playing it for a while. This is the reason I've taken long breaks and the only reason.

Overall, I definitely recommend this games to starters of the mmorpg worlds.
Even so, I still recommend this game to experienced mmorpg players as well. This game goes back to the classics. Classes of Fighter, Mage, Cleric, and Archer can never let you down. To add, the developers have even added Trickster, and Crusader to those who want a little variety. note* Crusader becomes availible at level 60. I always seem to come back to this game even if it is repetitive because I miss it, and I think others who have reviewed have the same feelings. It's a relaxing game that has cute sprites and reliable gameplay. I think that's all from me ^^

reviewText:
A F2P PLAYER'S REVIEW!

Well nearly 2k hours into fiesta and still haven't decided to write something about it I figured I'd write one now, anyway, your probably wondering why I'm not recommending this game. Clearly 1.8k hours I SHOULD know something about fiesta and how it works. Well your in luck as I do, bare bones this game is extremely P2W and grindy as **** to the point that it just became to much.

Now in some more detail about this game:

Lets start with the bad parts of the game!

-The cash shop:

Most MMORPGs usually have a cash shop which you buy stuff from and for me personally any cash shop that offers boosts to a player's stats things such as DMG,crit, crit rate, HP or whatever form of boost aren't exactly something I like unless it's from a event or obtainable via in game boss or dungeon run things of that nature that can give F2P players the same opportunities as P2W players and I do understand that companies must be profitable to maintain operations of a game however fiesta I feel just lets you download the game for free just to make a few hundreds or more off of you and make you work your *** off for close to nothing. Not only that but their cast shot is virtually stat boost that only last for 30 days at a time before you have to buy something to replace your old outfit.

What's also kind of funny the cash shop can make a mage into a tank.
-The community:

Now this one is a little hard to put on the bad however there are a lot more bad apples then there is good ones when I first started playing this game I joined a guild abid it was a small guild with a good guild leader and members and they REALLY were the only people that kept me playing for as long as I did, however, a more big guild eventually absorbed our guild into it and I met a much larger community and that's when I realized how bad the community really is most of the level 100+ abid some aren't as bad as others but still it's bad most people I met seemed to be WAYY to power hungry and into PvP (Which is really broken due to the nature of the game) ill admit that being power hungry isn't a bad thing or being into PvP, however, one instance from the guild I was in one of the strongest players (We had 2-3 of the top players in our server) in our guild decided that instead of sharing loot which was distributed by how many runs you do which normally take about 2-3 hours to get done per run to keep the loot they got that did get our guild leader angry but decided to let them keep the loot because of the fear of losing one of our top players rather then keeping his word and promises to the other within our guild.

For as long as I've been with this game I did noticed that newer player areas really don't have any life to it normally you wont see other players in Roumen (Newb town) or they'll be afk or something like that. Most people that are lower levels get power leveled by higher level players normally for free or they'll ask for gold in return for leveling (yes it's not against the TOS at least the power leveling part is not so much the asking for money part).

-Events...

This one is pretty short, Events in this game are practically nothing. Most events are done on forums which I can say just is lame because it gives the game a feel of nothing interesting is happening which is most part nothing IS happening. And when a event is out it's normally just something for Halloween or xmas that's really the only 2 events you are normally guaranteed to have. Most other events happen on blue moons or out of the blue.

-The player market

Another short one I'm getting tired of writing so ill try to keep everything from here on out short. The player market everything is really over priced even after I quit the prices of things only really just gone up and that's about it. It's a real problem.

-Scammers

Not that often you'll find people that would go out of their way to screw you over for money or whatever but a common scam in this game is gifting this game does let you gift cash shop items from other players sweet and all right? Wrong, as people normally know you need to spend money to be able to even gift (I don't know much about it as I never gifted or brought items from the cash shop) Scammers know this and would say something like give me the money first and ill gift you first or if they want to get something for free from a gifter they'll asked to be gifted first. There are other scams out there, however, that's the most common one other scams aren't done as much however that's the most common one out there.

-THE GRIND

OH GOD, Can I say this game becomes just to grindy to the point you have to do it for hours to just see 5% for level 105 at black bear repeat quest with a party of level 100-105 this game starts to get grindy at levels 61+ and slows and slows down a lot to the point it's not fun to play even with a group of high level players the grind becomes old pretty quick.

The good of this game FINALLY!

So here we are at the good things about fiesta good on you if you read this far into it.

-The community

While this is in the bad part it also has it's good bits it really does if your able to find a guild or a group of players to play with regularly this game becomes VERYYY addictive because of how fun it can be to run a high level kingdom quest or do group repeat quests to level up.

-It's about as classic of a MMORPG as you can get

Title says it all fiesta is for the most part the most classic of a MMORPG as you can get to at least as far as I know.

-The end-

I know this review isn't a perfect one at all but I do hope it help you out a fair bit in not picking this game up.  my personal rating of this game it would have to be 3.3 out of 10.

reviewText:
Played this game since Approx 2009 - 2010.
Fiesta Online is an anime based MMORPG taking place in the realm of Isya. At time of this review you have 6 class choices; Fighter (your typical tank), Cleric (Healer roll), Mage (Ranged magic damage), Archer (Ranged physical damage), Trickster/Joker (A dual wielding melee class) and most recently added, Crusader (A interesting mix of Physical damage, magical damage and healing abilities).
The tutorial is very straight forward and welcoming to new players. Alternatively, there are many academies (A training group for guilds) who are filled with happy and helpful people who can help you out!
The current level cap is 125, with many quests to help get you there. Early levels can be simple to level, but the higher you get, the more challenging it becomes, but it is doable!

Over the years, I've watched the game evolve, go through glorious moments and struggles. At present, I believe Gamigo are doing a fantastic job at trying to keep the game fresh and bug free as possible, while trying to constantly impress a negative community (grown from all the messed up patchs and previous lack of listening to the community).

Regardless, this game IS ADDICTIVE! After spending time on various other MMORPGs, I always find sooner or laterI get drawn back to this game. And I have this game to thank that I have made a few friends for life.

So give it a try, it's free, and you've got nothing to lose!

~Pagel Server~

Not that often you'll find people that would go out of their way to screw you over for money or whatever but a common scam in this game is gifting this game does let you gift cash shop items from other players sweet and all right? Wrong, as people normally know you need to spend money to be able to even gift (I don't know much about it as I never gifted or brought items from the cash shop) Scammers know this and would say something like give me the money first and ill gift you first or if they want to get something for free from a gifter they'll asked to be gifted first. There are other scams out there, however, that's the most common one other scams aren't done as much however that's the most common one out there.

-THE GRIND

OH GOD, Can I say this game becomes just to grindy to the point you have to do it for hours to just see 5% for level 105 at black bear repeat quest with a party of level 100-105 this game starts to get grindy at levels 61+ and slows and slows down a lot to the point it's not fun to play even with a group of high level players the grind becomes old pretty quick.

The good of this game FINALLY!

So here we are at the good things about fiesta good on you if you read this far into it.

-The community

While this is in the bad part it also has it's good bits it really does if your able to find a guild or a group of players to play with regularly this game becomes VERYYY addictive because of how fun it can be to run a high level kingdom quest or do group repeat quests to level up.

-It's about as classic of a MMORPG as you can get

Title says it all fiesta is for the most part the most classic of a MMORPG as you can get to at least as far as I know.

-The end-

I know this review isn't a perfect one at all but I do hope it help you out a fair bit in not picking this game up.  my personal rating of this game it would have to be 3.3 out of 10.

reviewText:
Game is very pay2win and grindy after you get to a certain level. Spamming repeats and saving quests for levels with no repeats is the only way to level after a while. But there's more than just spamming repeats. There are Kingdom Quests, where you join other similar leveled people to beat the boss...or survive for a period of time.  The Kingdom quests and the anime style are the two reasons I keep coming back.

The population isn't very high, but there is a server merge going on, so that might fix things like people buying instance runs. The economy is also very broken. Things that used to cost like 80g now cost gems because the server is being flooded with money with no good gold sink.

Even with all the problems with this game, I still recommend it. I still enjoy playing and interacting with the community in game.



Edit: As much as I liked this game, even I have to admit that Fiesta is dead at this point. I've seen some things...like people being paid small amounts to just make a Fiesta account. I've moved on, and so should other people who play this game, or are thinking about playing this game.
